document.masterDocTitle: A catalogue of Indian Arctiinae (Erebidae, Lepidoptera)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A catalogue of Indian Arctiinae (Erebidae, Lepidoptera)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Distribution: Meghalaya (Khasi Hills) (
Singh et al . 2014
, Zerny 1912 ).

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution: Throughout Continental India ( Kirti & Gill 2008e ), Himachal Pradesh (Kangra), Sikkim , West Bengal , Maharashtra ( Bombay ), Tamil Nadu (Nilgiris, Coimbatore (Hampson 1898, Zerny 1912 ), Meghalaya (Shillong), [ Bihar ] (Pusa), Karnataka (Coorg) ( Fletcher 1925 ).

Remark:
Amata (Syntomis) divisa disrupta (Moore, 1878)
is known from China only.

paragraph.materialsCitation: Type locality: Canara [Coastal Karnataka ], Travancore , Pirmad [ Kerala ] 3,500â ft

bibRefCitation.refString: Leech, J. H. (1889) On a collection of Lepidoptera from Kiukiang. Transactions of the Entomological Society of London, 1889, 99 - 145. https: // doi. org / 10.1111 / j. 1365 - 2311.1889. tb 02699. x

bibRefCitation.author: Rothschild, L. W.
bibRefCitation.refString: Rothschild, L. W. (1910) Catalogue of the Arctianae in the Tring museum, with notes and descriptions of new species. Novitates Zoologicae, 17, 1 - 85. https: // doi. org / 10.5962 / bhl. part. 13688

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remark:
Amata formosae ( Butler, 1876 )
restricted to Taiwan was reported from India by
Singh et al . (2014)
following Zerny (1912) as
Amata emma
(Indian species) was synonmised with it. Now,
A. emma
is valid species and
A . formosae
is synonymised with
A. edwardsii
, thus
formosae
and
edwardsii
both are not reported from India (
Lu et al. 2012
) and excluded from this list.

Distribution: Maharashtra ( Bombay , Matheran, Mahabaleshwar), Tamil Nadu (Nilgiri Hills) ( Zerny 1912 ), Maharashtra (Malshej Ghat) (
Kirti & Gill 2008 e
, Singh et al . 2014), Pune, Satara (
Sondhi et al . 2021
).

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type locality: Momeit [ Myanmar ],
2000 ft
, June (Doherty)
Type locality: S. India , Nilgiri plateau

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution: Continental India (Goa, Karnataka , North West Himalayas) ( Kirti & Gill 2008e ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remark: Davlatov & Wu, (2018) did not followed different subspecies pattern while synonymizing
Caeneressa diaphana hunanensis Obraztsov, 1957: 428
(from China ). The subspecies concept given by Obrazastov (1957) and followed by
Lu et al. (2012)
and
Kirti et al. (2014a)
is adopted here.

Remark: The species was erroreously mentioned as
Caeneressa melaena ( Walker, 1854 ) Kirti et al . (2014)
. 646.
Caeneressa newara ( Moore, 1879 )
: 12
Distribution: Sikkim ( Zerny 1912 ), West Bengal (Darjeeling) ( Fletcher 1925 ).
Remark: Type locality erroreously mentioned as Sikkim by Davlatov & Wu (2018) .

paragraph.materialsCitation: Type locality: North India (Location not specified)
